rootPath.description: The root folder where the gateway will work.

apiPath.description: Folder where the gateway will search for installed APIs.

middlewarePath.description: Folder where the gateway will search for its middleware functions.

underProxy.description: If we are behind a reverse proxy (Heroku, Bluemix, AWS if you use an ELB, custom Nginx setup, etc)

level.description: Level of messages that this logger should log.

timestamp.description: Flag indicating if we should prepend output with timestamps (default true).

silent.description: Flag indicating whether to suppress output.

colorize.description: Flag indicating if we should colorize output.

json.description: If true, messages will be logged as JSON (default true).

stringify.description: Flag indiciating if the output should be passed through JSON.stringify, resulting in single-line output. Most useful when used in conjunction with the json flag. (default false).

prettyPrint.description: If true, additional JSON metadata objects that are added to logging string messages will be displayed as a JSON string representation.

depth.description: Numeric indicating how many times to recurse while formatting the object with util.inspect.

humanReadableUnhandledException.description: Flag indicating if uncaught exception should be output as human readable, instead of a single line.

showLevel.description: Flag indicating if we should prepend output with level (default true).

stderrLevels.description: Array of strings containing the levels to log to stderr instead of stdout, for example ['error', 'debug', 'info']. (default ['error', 'debug']).

filename.description: The filename of the logfile to write output to.

timestamp.description: Flag indicating if we should prepend output with timestamps (default true).

silent.description: Flag indicating whether to suppress output.

colorize.description: Flag indicating if we should colorize output.

maxsize.description: Max size in bytes of the logfile, if the size is exceeded then a new file is created, a counter will become a suffix of the log file.

maxFiles.description: Limit the number of files created when the size of the logfile is exceeded.

json.description: If true, messages will be logged as JSON (default true).

eol.description: String indicating the end-of-line characters to use (default to \n).

prettyPrint.description: If true, additional JSON metadata objects that are added to logging string messages will be displayed as a JSON string representation.

depth.description: Numeric indicating how many times to recurse while formatting the object with util.inspect (only used with prettyPrint true) (default null, unlimited).

logstash.description: If true, messages will be logged as JSON and formatted for logstash (default false).

showLevel.description: Flag indicating if we should prepend output with level (default true).

tailable.description: If true, log files will be rolled based on maxsize and maxfiles, but in ascending order. The filename will always have the most recent log lines. The larger the appended number, the older the log file. This option requires maxFiles to be set, or it will be ignored.

maxRetries.description: The number of stream creation retry attempts before entering a failed state. In a failed state the transport stays active but performs a NOOP on it's log function. (default 2)

zippedArchive.description: If true, all log files but the current one will be zipped.

host.description: Redis host name or IP address.

msg.description: Customize the default logging message. E.g. "{{res.statusCode}} {{req.method}} {{res.responseTime}}ms {{req.url}}", "HTTP {{req.method}} {{req.url}}".

expressFormat.description: Use the default Express/morgan request formatting. Enabling this will override any msg if true. Will only output colors when colorize set to true.

colorize.description: Color the text and status code, using the Express/morgan color palette.

sufix.description: If true, the version will be at the prefix otherwise it will be as the prefix.

windowMs.description: How long to keep records of requests in memor (milliseconds).

delayAfter.description: Max number of connections during windowMs before starting to delay responses. Defaults to 1. Set to 0 to disable delaying.

delayMs.description: How long to delay the response, multiplied by (number of recent hits - delayAfter). Defaults to 1000 (1 second). Set to 0 to disable delaying.

max.description: Max number of connections during windowMs milliseconds before sending a 429 response. Defaults to 5. Set to 0 to disable.

message.description: Error message returned when max is exceeded. Defaults to 'Too many requests, please try again later.'

statusCode.description: HTTP status code returned when max is exceeded. Defaults to 429.

headers.description: Enable header to show request limit and current usage.

keyGenerator.description: The name of the function used to generate keys. By default user IP address (req.ip) is used.

handler.description: The name of the function to execute once the max limit is exceeded. It receives the request and the response objects. The "next" param is available if you need to pass to the next middleware.

groups.description: A list of groups that should be handled by this limiter. If not provided, everything will be handled. Defaults to *.
A list of groups that should be handled by this authenticator. If not provided, everything will be handled.

Proxy.description: Configuration for the API proxy engine.

path.description: The path where the gateway will listen for requests that should be proxied for the current API.

https.description: If set to true, will enforce the requests to the API target to use HTTPS protocol. If your path already define a protocol on target URL, this option is ignored.

supressViaHeader.description: If True, no Via header will be added to proxied responses.

filters.description: Add filters to the request pipeline. A Filter is a function that receives the request and the response object and must return a boolean value to inform it the given request should target the destination API or if it should be ignored.

preserveHostHdr.description: If true, the gateway will copy the host HTTP header to the proxied express server.

timeout.description: Configure a specific timeout for requests. Timed-out requests will respond with 504 status code and a X-Timeout-Reason header.

ProxyTarget.description: The target address of the proxied API. You can force the protocol to be used on the URL.

ProxyFilter.description: Add a filter to the request pipeline.

groups.description: A list of groups that should be filtered by this filter. If not provided, everything will be filtered. Defaults to *.

ProxyInterceptorList.description: A list of interceptors for the request pipeline.

ProxyInterceptor.description: An Interceptor is a function that receives the request or the response object and can modify these objects.

groups.description: A list of groups that should be filtered by this filter. If not provided, everything will be filtered. Defaults to *.

verify.description: Is a function with the parameters verify(userid, password, done).
Is a function with the parameters verify(userid, password, done).

usernameField.description: The user name field. Defaults to 'username'.

secreteOrKey.description: A REQUIRED string or buffer containing the secret (symmetric) or PEM-encoded public key (asymmetric) for verifying the token's signature.

issuer.description: If defined the token issuer (iss) will be verified against this value.

audience.description: If defined, the token audience (aud) will be verified against this value.

algorithms.description: List of strings with the names of the allowed algorithms. For instance, ["HS256", "HS384"].

ignoreExpiration.description: If true do not validate the expiration of the token.

verify.description: Is a function with the parameters verify(request, jwt_payload, done).

JWTRequestExtractor.description: Defines how the JWT token will be extracted from request.

header.description: Extracts the token from the specified header.

queryParam.description: Extracts the token from the specified query param.

authHeader.description: Extracts the token from the 'auth' header.

bodyField.description: Extracts the token from the specified body param.

cookie.description: Extract the token from the specified cookie param.

groups.description: List of groups that should be handled by this limiter. If not provided, everything will be handled.

ClientCache.description: Configuration for a client side cache (in browser).

ServerCache.description: Configuration for a server side cache (in Memory or with a Redis store)
